display

Class PopScreenControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • display.PopScreenControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class PopScreenControl
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
    The PopScreenControl class is a BorderPane which holds all the buttons for the control of PopScreen and Population. It takes references of the elements it controls such as the PopScreen instance or MultiTest instances. It handles the Population and with it the mutation procedure. Clicking a button adds a PopulationTask to a task queue and is then executed.

    NOTE: The refresh() method has to be called every frame to ensure the correct labelling of some "dynamic" buttons and the execution of the PopulationTasks.

    This class uses the Layout class for the way of displaying the elements.

    • Field Detail

      • multiTest

        private final test.MultiTest multiTest
        multiTest is a reference to the MultiTest instance this PopScreenControl instance has control over.

      • testScreen

        private final TestScreen testScreen
        testScreen is a reference to the TestScreen instance this PopScreenControl instance has control over. It is needed to display Creature instances in the main TestScreen

      • pop

        private final population.Population pop
        pop holds the reference to the main Population this instance is controlling.

      • popScreen

        private final PopScreen popScreen
        popScreen hold the reference to the main PopScreen. This is mainly used for refresh() and applying the TestProgressBar.

      • testProgressBar

        private population.TestProgressBar testProgressBar
        testProgressBar is a progress bar that is being shown when the MultiTest is performing calculations. It displays the progress of the calculation.

      • tasks

        private java.util.ArrayList<population.PopulationTask> tasks
        This queue holds PopulationTask enums. All tasks are added to the queue and are then later processed in the order they were added.

      • gp_controls

        private javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gp_controls
        gp_controls is the GridPane which holds all the buttons and arranges them accordingly.

      • btn_singleAction

        private javafx.scene.control.Button btn_singleAction
        This button adds the next action which can be performed on the Population to the queue.

      • btn_1G

        private javafx.scene.control.Button btn_1G
        This button adds multiple actions to the queue to calculate one entire generation.

      • btn_10G

        private javafx.scene.control.Button btn_10G
        This button adds multiple actions to the queue to calculate ten entire generations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PopScreenControl

        public PopScreenControl(TestScreen testScreen_in,
                        test.MultiTest multiTest_in,
                        PopScreen popScreen_in,
                        population.Population pop_in)
        Initialises the new PopScreenControl instance with references to the elements it controls. The layout is initialised and EventListeners are added.
        Parameters:
        testScreen_in - reference to the TestScreen instance this PopScreenControl should have control over.
        multiTest_in - reference to the MultiTest instance this PopScreenControl should have control over.
        popScreen_in - reference to the PopScreen instance this PopScreenControl should have control over.
        pop_in - reference to the main Population this PopScreenControl controls.

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Handles the labelling of "dynamic" buttons and execution of PopulationTasks from the tasks queue. All the tasks currently in the queue are executed (in the order they were added) and then removed from the queue.

        If a calculation using MultiTest is running, no more tasks are being executed.

        If a calculation using MultiTest is done, the TestProgressBar is removed automatically from the PopScreen referenced during initialisation.

      • singleAction

        private void singleAction()
        This method is called, when the multi-purpose button had been pressed. It automatically looks for the next step the Population has to go through and executes the code right away or adds it to the task queue.

      • do1Gen

        private void do1Gen()
        This method is called when one whole generation should be calculated. PopulationTask commands are added to the tasks queue to calculate an entire generation. The current generation is completed and the commands for mutations, sorting etc. is added in the correct order to the queue.

        The TestProgressBar is shown by executing this method.

      • do10Gen

        private void do10Gen()
        This method is called when 10 whole generations should be calculated. PopulationTask commands are added to the tasks queue to calculate 10 entire generations. The current generation is completed and the commands for mutations, sorting etc. is added in the correct order to the queue.

        The TestProgressBar is shown by executing this method.
